[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: derive_decryption_key_share()] [Share derivation] Can malicious master secret key shares derive decryption key shares that reveal information about other validators' shares? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: derive_decryption_key_share()] [Digest manipulation] Can attackers provide crafted digests to derive_decryption_key_share() that cause key derivation to leak master secret key information? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: derive_decryption_key_share()] [Determinism] Is key share derivation deterministic, or can non-determinism cause different validators to derive inconsistent shares from the same inputs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: reconstruct_decryption_key()] [Threshold violation] Can an attacker successfully reconstruct decryption keys with fewer than threshold shares by exploiting Lagrange interpolation weaknesses? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: reconstruct_decryption_key()] [Malicious shares] Does reconstruct_decryption_key() validate that shares are from authorized validators before reconstruction, preventing Sybil attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: reconstruct_decryption_key()] [Share ordering] Can attackers manipulate the order of shares in the input array to cause reconstruction to produce incorrect keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: reconstruct_decryption_key()] [Duplicate shares] Does the function detect and reject duplicate shares from the same validator that could bias the reconstruction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: reconstruct_decryption_key()] [Config mismatch] Can mismatched threshold_config parameters between derivation and reconstruction cause security degradation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Parallel race condition] Does the parallel processing using into_par_iter() on line 163 introduce race conditions when preparing ciphertexts concurrently? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Error propagation] If one ciphertext preparation fails in the parallel iterator, does the entire batch fail atomically or can partial results leak information? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Proof mismatch] Can attackers provide eval_proofs that don't match the ciphertexts, causing prepare() to succeed but decrypt to wrong plaintexts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Digest tampering] Can digest parameter manipulation during preparation cause prepared ciphertexts to decrypt with wrong keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Memory exhaustion] Can extremely large ciphertext batches exhaust memory during parallel preparation, causing validator crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Order preservation] Does parallel processing preserve ciphertext order, or can reordering cause plaintexts to be mismatched with wrong transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Parallel decryption race] Does parallel decryption using into_par_iter() on line 172 properly isolate decryption operations, or can concurrent access corrupt shared state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Type safety] Can the generic Plaintext type P be exploited to decrypt to unexpected types that violate protocol security assumptions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Partial failure] If some ciphertexts in the batch fail to decrypt, does the entire batch fail or can partial plaintexts leak information about decryption keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Key reuse] Can the same decryption key be safely reused across multiple decrypt() calls, or does this enable related-key attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Error handling] Does decrypt() distinguish between malformed ciphertexts and wrong keys, potentially leaking information through error messages? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Timing attacks] Can timing differences in parallel decryption reveal information about plaintext content or decryption key structure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: verify_decryption_key_share()] [Verification bypass] Can malicious validators provide invalid decryption key shares that pass verification but cause key reconstruction to fail or produce wrong keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: verify_decryption_key_share()] [Digest reuse] Can attackers reuse verification from one digest to validate shares for a different digest, bypassing proper validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: verify_decryption_key_share()] [Verification key mismatch] Does the function ensure verification_key_share corresponds to the validator claiming to provide the decryption_key_share? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: verify_decryption_key_share()] [Batch verification] Is there a batch verification optimization, and if so, can attackers exploit it to sneak invalid shares past verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx.rs] [Function: decrypt_individual()] [Preparation bypass] Does decrypt_individual() properly validate inputs before calling prepare_individual(), or can attackers skip necessary preparation steps? (High)
